title: Relay for Life event celebrates cancer survivors
content: VESTAL (WBNG) -- The American Cancer Society is hosting its Relay for Life of Broome-Tioga Scare Away Cancer event Saturday night until 11 p.m.     Dozens of people have joined together at Sammon Field on Clayton Avenue in Vestal. It's near the Vestal Central School District.     The purpose of the event is to celebrate cancer survivors, raise money for research and programs within the American Cancer Society and spread awareness.     Different vendors and organizations filled the field. As of Saturday evening nearly $60,000 has been raised with an $80,000 goal.     "It's is so gratifying to be here," said Broome-Tioga Relay for Life event coordinator Deborah Eckhardt. "It's a labor of love. Planning starts in October and today is just the culmination of many hours of hard work."    The event is open to the public. Click here for more event details.     "Like" Esperanza Gutierrez on
